alert.note: Alert for Brooks; Cameron Island; Coastal Cameron; Coastal Kenedy; Coastal Willacy; Inland Cameron; Inland Kenedy; Inland Willacy; Jim Hogg; Kenedy Island; Northern Hidalgo; Southern Hidalgo; Starr; Willacy Island; Zapata (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued March 02 at 10:10PM CST until March 03 at 9:00AM CST by NWS Brownsville
info.description: ...ELEVATED TO CRITICAL FIRE WEATHER CONDITIONS POSSIBLE FOR ALL OF DEEP SOUTH TEXAS AND THE RIO GRANDE VALLEY THROUGH FRIDAY MORNING... .A strong cold front will bring lower humidity and gusty northwesterly winds tonight into early Friday morning. When combined with cured fuels and moderate to severe drought conditions, this could lead to the rapid and erratic spread of wildfires tonight. Conditions improve later Friday morning as winds diminish. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 AM CST FRIDAY FOR FOR STRONG WINDS, CURED FUELS, AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY VALUES FOR THE RIO GRANDE PLAINS AND NORTHERN RANCHLANDS... * AFFECTED AREA...Zapata, Jim Hogg, Brooks, Inland Kenedy, Starr, Southern Hidalgo, Inland Willacy, Inland Cameron, Coastal Kenedy, Northern Hidalgo, Coastal Willacy, Coastal Cameron, Kenedy Island, Willacy Island and Cameron Island. * TIMING...Until 9 AM Friday. * WINDS...Northwest 15 to 25 mph with gusts up to 45 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 13 percent. * TEMPERATURES...In the upper 60s. * LIGHTNING...Very low chance. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
